Hey You have a new sub from me! I've been binge watching anything space x related of yours. One humble critique, I really love your music and the fact its all home made but sometimes I feel it might be a little loud and perhaps doesn't allow us to here what the in game sounds are etc. I'm sure you spend a lot of time thinking about how you want the audio in your videos, just my two cents! I cant complain though its great music.
Wow, the quality difference (and the room) from todays videos to this are incredible. You have made such progress in under a year!!

Don't do your intercepts like that, 253 m/s intercept speed is quite high. Get into a slightly higher orbit, circularize then adjust your PE to be on the final orbit. You can still intercept within one orbit, but is much more precise and more forgiving if you do mistakes.

With such a high intercept velocity, if you have a low TWR rocket, you'll have to burn for minutes, risk the chance of missing the window and costing you more dV in the long run.

Also you need to learn some tricks in regards to burning anti-target to intercept. You don't burn on anti target, you don't burn on retrograde, in fact you burn on the other side of the retrograde marker, aligned with the anti-target, to "push" it onto your anti-target marker. That's the most efficient way to burn for a intercept.

Finding this channel was like finding gold
This is actually such a good channel
Try pointing your rocket prograde as soon as you launch using the SAS so as the rocket ascends the prograde vector moves sideways and levels out at 60 km so you can get into orbit easily.👍🚀🔬

pro tips...  your gravity turns are WAY to late, start your turn at 1-2K and be at 45deg by 10k.  and when you are decelerating at your intercept, point to the opposite side of your retrograde, which will adjust course towards the target so you don't have to flip and burn any more times.
